Authors: Chao Ge Wang, Josef Vlasák, Yu Cheng Dai
Title:
Phylogeny and diversity of Bjerkandera (Polyporales,
Basidiomycota), including four new species from South America and
Asia
Abstract:
Four new species of Bjerkandera, viz. B. ecuadorensis, B.
fulgida, B. minispora and B. resupinata spp. nov., are described
respectively from tropical America and Asia (Ecuador, China and
Thailand). B. ecuadorensis is characterised by dark gray to black pore
surface, a monomitic hyphal system, hyaline to yellowish-brown
generative hyphae, snd ellipsoid basidiospores measuring 3.94.5 × 2.73
μm. B. fulgida is distinguished from the other species in the genus by
clay buff to pale brown and glancing pore surface. B. minispora is
characterised by white tomentose pore mouth and small basidiospores
measuring 3.14.2 × 22.8 μm. B. resupinata is characterised by resupinate
basidiocarps, pinkish buff to pale brownish pore surface, and ellipsoid
to broadly ellipsoid basidiospores measuring 4.56 × 3.24.1 µm. The
closely related taxa to four new species are discussed. An
identification key to then ten accepted species of Bjerkandera is
provided.
